ps140: Grant me compunction, and distancing from evil* and perfect repentance:* to me who is drowning in carnal passion* and is far from you, O God the King of all,* to me who have no other hope.* And save me the prodigal, O Jesus all-mighty, the Saviour of our souls.

The admirable Moses, cleansed by fasting* saw the One for Whom he longed.* Imitating him, O my humble soul,* strive to cleanse yourself of evil on the day of abstinence,* so that you can see the Lord* Who grants you forgiveness, cleansing and salvation,* and Who is good and loves mankind.

Let us now start with joy the second week of fasting,* completing day by day, O brothers*. Let us make ourselves a fiery chariot, like Elijah the Tishbite,* from the four great virtues.* Let us raise our mind through absence of passions* let us arm our flesh with purity,* and thus we shall prevail over the enemy.
aposticha: Come, let us cleanse ourselves with alms and generosity to the needy,* neither playing trumpets nor publicising our good deeds,* so that our left arm remains ignorant of the acts of the right hand,* lest vainglory wastes fruits of the alms.* But let us cry out in secret to Him Who knows everything secret:* Father, forgive us our trespasses, for You love mankind.
O Martyrs of the Lord,* you sanctify every place* and heal every sickness:* pray even now to save our souls from the nets of the enemy,* we beg you!
The heavenly hosts chant to You O unwedded Mother, blessed in joy.* And we glorify Your inscrutable Birth-giving, O Mother of God.* Pray that our souls be saved.
